result.execSummary:
The defendant James Francis Gillard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent/Deliver Narcotics [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(a).
  • Possession of Firearm by Felon, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to any sentence now serving.

superMiscConds.notes: $518 costs--DOC collect.  If extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Any treatment/counseling as deemed necessary.
Seized weapon to be forfeited to RCSO.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with count 1, consecutive to any sentence now serving.
Concurrent with count 1, consecutive to any sentence now serving.

IT IS ORDERED that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision upon receipt of this order, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision. The number of days that are converted from Confinement Time to Extended Supervision will be determined by a DOC records office staff member and will be based upon actual release Date.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the prisoner is assigned shall effect his or her release upon receipt of this order.
